meanings.definition: The plural form of terminus, meaning the end or final point of something.
meanings.sent1: The train journey reached its termini at the last station.
meanings.sent2: The bus route has multiple termini where passengers can get off.
meanings.sent3: The race to the ice cream truck had the kids racing to the termini of the street.
meanings.sent4: The detective's investigation led him to the termini of the mystery, where all clues converged.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map marked the X at the termini of the old oak tree, hidden from sight.

meanings.definition: The plural form of terminus, meaning a station or stop at the end of a transportation route.
meanings.sent1: The termini of the subway line were bustling with commuters.
meanings.sent2: The termini of the bus routes were clearly marked with signs.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons gathered at the termini of the train tracks, waiting for scraps.
meanings.sent4: The airport was the termini for many international flights, connecting people worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The termini of the river cruise offered stunning views of the city skyline.
